page.title: 07Woodland Destruction cont.
page.content:
{1A's own thoughts} Without the trees the area would be very bare and it would soon become vandalized and ugly. All the wildlife - insects, birds and animals - which have their home in the trees would also be destroyed. Some are very rare species. The new route for the pipeline is cheaper than the original one. We are very glad the trees have been saved. {1A's survey July 8th 1985} The class carried out a survey in Blacon High School: Q1) How many pupils a) know about the crisis?A: 285 b) don't know? A: 160
Q2) How many pupils are a) against this action? A: 406 b) for this action? A: 21 c) don't know? A: 23
